reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not wanting to bust the bank we stayed in the tourist standard twin room that this hotel offers. Whilst our expectations were not too high, they were certainly not exceeded as it felt that the room was halfway through being renovated as some parts were brand new and others absolutely tired and worn out.
reviews.title: Not brilliant, but not bad either

reviews.text: Given the size of the rooms, which were not big they were exceptionally practical and there was tons more storage than we could ever need for two people. The walls between rooms are thin and the people adjacent were really noisy on the first night and it would have been a problem had that continued. However, I am guessing that they simply didn't realise that the room next door was occupied as for the rest of the stay we didn't hear a thing at nights.
reviews.title: Great Holiday In Bulduri, Jurmala

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As many reviewers mentioned it is a basic hotel. However, it has been renovated from old Soviet style, and overall, for location and quality, is excellent. Staff is polite. I would say it is nature of people up North to be more reserved. Rooms are clean, the restaurant on the 10th floor has a beautiful view, as well great food and selection of spirits. Breakfast is buffet style and basic, but filling. it is very close to the rail way station, and it takes 30 minutes to be in downtown of Riga.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: I only stayed there for 3 nights while in Jurmala for business in November, which is regarded off-season. My room was basic, but the view was terrific, overlooking the sea and a large section of big trees. Breakfast was nothing to write home about, although was OK. The front office staff could be a bit politer. We had a car on our disposal and location-wise I can't really judge. Don't expect too much and you will be content.
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.text: We spent 9 nights here with an 8 year old and a 5 year old. We stayed in one of the business class rooms which was modern and clean although a bit small. We had a room with a double bed and a separate ‘living’ room with a sofa bed that pretty much filled it, plus a bathroom. There was a digital safe in the room that packed up halfway through our stay that was never fixed despite a couple of visits by the hotel handyman. There is an excellent indoor pool and a spa, breakfast was good if you’re happy with Swedish buffet and the staff were reserved but helpful. It’s in a great spot for the beach and maybe a 30 – 40 minute walk into the main resort centre although it’s easy to catch a train for next to nothing from the nearby (5 minute walk) station. There are also regular and cheap trains to Riga and beyond (we had a good day out to see the castles at Sigulda).
reviews.title: different beach holiday

reviews.text: Stayed for seven nights in the Lielupe in August. The hotel facilities are OK but there seems to be a real problem with the staff. For example, there is a fantastic restaurant in the top floor (spectacular views and great food) but although the advertised closing time is 1.00am we were kicked out at 11pm, only to find it was open again, for Latvians and Russians, at 12! Other problems included rooms not being cleaned (eg sheets in the baby's cot not being changed despite having sick all over them), rude bar staff refusing to serve females and management who agree to rectify problems but then tell the staff something completely different (luckily conversation with manager recorded on mobile phone). It is a shame because the hotel is pretty good and in good location but the staff appear to have a big problem with people from the UK.
reviews.title: good hotel, terrible staff

reviews.text: The pool and spa info on the hotel website prompted me to book this hotel. Rooms were spacious but very basic (very small single beds). Pool and jacuzzi, steam room etc were fabulous. Restaurant on top floor was lovely. Breakfast was ok, not a huge variety though. Location was good, right on the beach and plenty of transport into Majori, the main tourist centre of Jurmala. Would certainly recommend using one of the spa hotel in Majori for treatments!!!!!
reviews.title: Great facilities

reviews.text: Very nice budget (not in peak season!) accommodation in Jurmala. Hotel is completely renovated and became a property with modern interiors/exterior. Definitely visit terrace restaurant "Balta Kapa" on the 10th floor - you will be rewarded with beautiful views of the Gulf of Riga and Jurmala itself, stuff they cook is also very good, but choice of beer is very poor... Breakfast is served in separate area - on the 1st floor and it is quite rich with a big choice of hot food and snacks. Hotel is located close to a beach in silent residential part of Jurmala. But if you want some more movement - Jurmala's famous Jomas street with huge amount of restaurants and other entertainment options is located not so far away - 2 stops by train. I stayed in standard room, but it was nice and clean, it also had a small balcony. So, in conclusion - I recommend!
reviews.title: Good choice for Jurmala

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plus side- Room itself was a bit basic but spotlessly clean, Breakfast was great, loads of choice, hot cooked breakfasts, fruit, cheese, meat, cereal, toast,etc. Rooftop restaurant - don't expect quick service but the two guys who run it do their best and it was great to sit up there in the evening with a cocktail or two watching the sun set over the beach and treetops on the veranda.Beach is really close and superb- flat, clean, sandy, goes on for miles, sunsets that were fantastic, beach taverns dotted along it, plus loos and changing cubicles. Russian National Ice Hockey team staying/training at the hotel for their Summer Camp while we were there. We didn't use the hotel pools/gym, etc but they looked ok.
reviews.title: A good hotel handy for the beach

reviews.text: Downside-You had to get a bus to go to the centre of the main 'action'/restaurants/clubs but that was only 10 minutes and really cheap. No air conditioning but reception told us it was exceptional warm weather (Russian heat wave blowing over apparently), temp certainly in the high-30's while we were there for the beginning Aug, normally its cooler.
reviews.title: Great facilities, great location

reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Lielupe while travelling in Latvia. The staff were all extremely helpful and we felt very comfortable during our stay. We made good use of the two pools (indoor and outdoor) as well as the sauna and spa. We loved the location - just near the beach, local shops and restaurants. The walk down the beach into Majori was an easy 40 minute stroll.
reviews.title: Not what I expected.

reviews.text: It isn't cheap compared to other places we stayed at in Latvia, but we thought the extra expense was worthwhile.
reviews.title: A Soviet Hospital
